column4: I began the upgrade to Ubuntu 10.10 using the Update Manager.  During this time, I went walked away from the computer and the monitor's power saver mode has come on.  Now it doesn't seem to recognize the mouse or keyboard so I can't wake the computer.
Is there a way I can ssh in and see if the upgrade is complete?
retty can hijack process, but not sure you have it
or you can just ssh and wait when it is idle and check version
how do I check the version?
and is the version only updated once it is ready to be rebooted?
is the version the last package to be updated?
i do not think so, id rather apt-get upgrade first
that's a good idea.  If I do an apt-get upgrade it shows that there is a lock on the process
no it's locked because packages are still being installed
just use top or htop to see what up
something happens during the install process where the USB devices are no longer recognized
i think there in restart call after dist upgrade which you can see... going google
gantry? you there? uname -a againt list of kernels is centos way
